channel.title: Hackint0sh
channel.description: Anyone here running a hackint0sh machine? currently ive got one running on a second HDD on my i7 machine [IMG]http://pwnmypic.com/images/82331429554331646239.png[/img] I cant get the sound working with my motherboard yet (Gigabyte EX-58 UD3R) and for some reason it reads my RAM as DDR2 but apart from that its working perfectly

item.title: Hackint0sh
item.dc:creator: @peterbjornx peterbjornx
item.description:
@peterbjornx wrote:

It means that your PATA controller is not supported, so it cant find the DVD drive, you can still installl on a other pc and swap HDD’s, i fixed it that way, (Still no DVD tho)

Read full topic

item.title: Hackint0sh
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:305535”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=401769.msg2978662#msg2978662 date=1254457237]

as always when i see a mac osx screenshot i have to wonder why people who are apparently designers don’t mind so much screen space being taken up by a useless bar
[/quote]This and why the fuck use hackintosh? it’s completely useless.

allows you to use apple applications on your machine without paying the extortionate fee that apple demand for their under equipped hardware

I’m all for never buying mac hardware (except for second hand very very cheap) but really there aren’t any mac applications that I use that isn’t also available for better operating systems. (IE, linux)

Well in my case, none of the major applications I use have a better, similar, or any counterpart in the Linux world.

Everything I use does, Firefox, openoffice, Eclipse, Netbeans, xchat, gimp. They all exist and actually run better under linux than under mac, especially the java stuff because apple insists on their own implementation that is usually a few versions behind sun’s.[/quote]
Im assuming he means more professional applications such as final cut pro and logic

Read full topic

Abraham if you cannot leopard to your computer using a retail installation and a 132 Boot CD then you probably shouldn’t be using it at all because it proves that your a idiot.

Ive been using 10.6.1 Snow Leopard on my Dell E1505 for awhile now. Screenshot is in screenshot thread.
[/quote]wow…are you fucking retarded? I TOLD HIM TO GIVE ME A FAST TORRENT YOU IDIOT, NOT TO EXPLAIN TO ME HOW THE FUCK I INSTALL IT

if you cannot understand what people say and interpret it to fit your pathetic assumptions as to what a person means, then you shouldnt be using the internet at all because it proves your a idiot.

l2english
[/quote]how ironic[/quote]
rage

item.title: Hackint0sh
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Mopman:

as always when i see a mac osx screenshot i have to wonder why people who are apparently designers don’t mind so much screen space being taken up by a useless bar

It’s actually very useful. Like for me when I’m using Final Cut Studio, it makes the interface much nicer. I can drop individual windows to the dock, and quickly open them without having to search through a drop down list in a taskbar. Not only that but it takes up less desktop when it’s scaled down.

Read full topic
